pr_title: Removed check to add default site data for both open and token based studies

timeline.message: removed check to add default site data only for open study

timeline.bodyText:
this should be a boolean value, why is it not a boolean?
also name should be changed to isDefault
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
how do you enforce that there is only one default location in place?
is there something that prevents a default location from being added?
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Default location is created only for open studies . Location will added into the system only through participant manager.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: okay, then do you need to create a locationBO for all studies, as you are doing here?
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Default location will be only once and its pre populated into the same while executing user reg server's database script.  Here we are only adding data into app_info, org_info and sites table.
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText: this should be set at the database level as the column default.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: will be handled during data integrity changes .
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: let's fix it here while the context is fresh.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: ping on this?
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: These changes already integrated through PR #713
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: I am not seeing these fixed in the follow up PR, please fix here.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Added the fixes to this PR now along with test case modification to accommodate the data integrity checks
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't this set to a readable value? if status is an enum (which I would recommend) then in the code you should refer to the status.value, and not put in the value directly.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: we already planned to introduce enum as part of code refactoring activity during area of improvement implementation. TO keep a track of this change if you are okay we can create a ticket and close this PR.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: let's fix here, it probably takes less time to fix while you familiar with the code and context.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: These changes already integrated through PR #713 . Hence request you to please approve this PR
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: I don't see this file in PR #713 at all. Please fix here.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Added the fixes to this PR now along with test case modification to accommodate the data integrity checks
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText: this looks like it should be a foreign key and not set to zero by default.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: This zero default values added only for open studies. However in the actual implementation correct foreign key value will added by participant manager.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: what do you mean actual implementation, I don't think this is a test file.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: I meant Participant Manager. The reason we set zero here was , when a study published in study builder and pushed the studymeta data into user reg server we do not have the created by information.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText:
where does this value get updated to its actual value?
To give you more context, each field should be populated with only correct data, And no dummy values should exist in the code.
If you are not able to gather the correct information because a certain part of the code is not ready, then the column should be removed until the code becomes ready.
Adding these columns in advance and filling them with dummy values, could lead to us accidentally releasing a software that creates and stores fake data, and I would like to prevent that when possible.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
Actual value will be participant manager logged in user's user id.
For Open study we need to create a default site each time a new open study published in study builder application  . Could you please let us know in this scenario what value we need to set for created by column to differentiate site creation .
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText:
If a value can be empty, it should be left as NULL.
Having a 0 value would prevent us from enforcing a foreign Key connection when needed.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: this is not addressed
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: fixed now
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText:
from what I can see this code creates and stores a default site associated with default location and store it within session, regardless of the type of study.
Why is it needed for token based studies?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Initial logic is to added default site each open study. However as the participant manager is still in the development phase  as a work around we have provided a database script to add the tokens and mapped to individual participants directly into the database object , we do not have any UI in place to add sites into the system. Hence these logic is added for default site for token based study as well.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText:
I don't see why that would mean any code change.
If you have a script to inject the values while the participant manager is in process then there is no need to alter the code, correct?
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: To make enroll into study, a participant needs to map to a site . When we are injecting participants through script for token based enrollment, site details is required or else enroll flow will break.
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText: please remove additional spacing between imports. Please refer to the styleguide for formatting of imports.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Fixed the format issue
replies.author: aswinijena100
